reactor.core.dispatch

Class WorkQueueDispatcher

  • java.lang.Object
    • reactor.core.dispatch.AbstractLifecycleDispatcher
      • reactor.core.dispatch.MultiThreadDispatcher
        • reactor.core.dispatch.WorkQueueDispatcher
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Executor, WaitingMood, Dispatcher, Resource

    public final class WorkQueueDispatcher
extends MultiThreadDispatcher
implements WaitingMood
    Implementation of a Dispatcher that uses a multi-threaded, multi-producer RingBuffer to queue tasks to execute.
    Since:
    1.1
    Author:
    Jon Brisbin, Stephane Maldini

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Description copied from interface: Resource
        Shutdown this active Resource such that it can no longer be used. If the resource carries any work, it will wait (but NOT blocking the caller) for all the remaining tasks to perform before closing the resource.
        Specified by:
        shutdown in interface Resource
        Overrides:
        shutdown in class AbstractLifecycleDispatcher

      • forceShutdown

        public void forceShutdown()
        Description copied from interface: Resource
        Shutdown this Resource, forcibly halting any work currently executing and discarding any tasks that have not yet been executed.

      • remainingSlots

        public long remainingSlots()
        Description copied from interface: Dispatcher
        Request the remaining capacity for the underlying shared state structure. E.g. RingBufferDispatcher will return RingBuffer.remainingCapacity().

        Specified by:
        remainingSlots in interface Dispatcher
        Returns:
        the remaining capacity if supported otherwise it returns a negative value.
